column4: The #PaycheckProtectionProgram has been a lifeline for millions of small businesses during the COVID-19 pandemic, but @SpeakerPelosi & @HouseDemocrats are more concerned with not giving @realDonaldTrump a “win” before the election than supporting Americans in need. https://t.co/CKNuyBaqK5

Tomorrow (10/2) at 4PM ET, Paul Lawrence, Under Secretary For Benefits at @DeptVetAffairs, will host a call with Georgia veterans and their families to discuss COVID-19 resources, the Blue Water Navy Act, and the Solid Start program. You can join the call at 833-380-0417. #GA08 https://t.co/hG6DsVRia9

Had a great call this morning with @UnitedFresh to discus ways to help the industry weather impacts of COVID-19, remedies for unfair trade practices, & encouraging retailers to buy American produce. I remain committed to our farmers & helping them through these difficult times. https://t.co/8IaGxb8qvJ

Supporting rural hospitals and health care facilities during the COVID-19 outbreak has been a key priority of mine. That's why I introduced the Assistance for Rural Health, Safety, and Educational Facilities Act (H.R. 7758). You can learn more here: https://t.co/FSgQ8DW04N

Earlier this week, @realDonaldTrump signed an executive order to enhance telehealth services in #RuralAmerica. This will not only improve care and treatment options for our rural communities now, but it'll also positively impact them for years to come. https://t.co/8Wa9I9D2Jc

The deadline to apply for @SBAgov's Paycheck Protection Program is June 30. PPP has been a lifeline for millions of small businesses, keeping doors open & Americans on payroll during the COVID-19 outbreak. 

Small businesses looking for info should visit https://t.co/QRlzPxi6ji. https://t.co/8v8PfTWbXB

I appreciate the @macon_chamber inviting me to join a virtual meeting with Middle GA business & community leaders this morning. We discussed the congressional response to COVID-19, resources for businesses impacted, an outlook for GA Ag, the defense spending bill, & more. #GA08 https://t.co/60rlZsIoB3

This afternoon, I joined @agripulse to discuss issues impacting our farm economy and rural America, including the congressional response to COVID-19, rural health care, and the case for writing a new Farm Bill. You can watch at the link below. https://t.co/npNeSfusGq

COVID-19 has forced everyone to quickly modernize workplaces and supply chains, and it is as important as ever that the federal government understands new technologies and partners closely with industries that can bring the federal government into the 21st century....

This afternoon, aircraft from Moody Air Force Base will conduct fly-overs in #GA08 to salute health care workers amid COVID-19. God Bless Team Moody as they salute our medical professionals, & we wish all health care workers good health & safety during this time. #MoodySalutes https://t.co/KIKHzm8HGA

Please join me today, on this #NationalDayofPrayer & during #NursesWeek, in praying for the nurses, doctors & first responders continually working to combat & contain COVID-19. We're with you & support you as you do your important work. We'll get through this together. God Bless. https://t.co/CIbsq43dQh
When we talk about the long-term impacts of #COVIDー19 on our national economy, we cannot forget the negative impacts it will have on our food supply chain....

American farmers are facing unprecedented challenges due to the COVID-19 outbreak, and they need our support. Please join me in making sure to buy “Georgia Grown” products when possible during this time. God Bless our Georgia farmers. #GA08 https://t.co/i9oTw4Zzx1

April 23, 2020, the House of Representative will convene today at 10 A.M. Most Americans regardless of party or philosophy expect that the House would then vote on replenishing the Paycheck Protection funds and appropriate new COVID testing funds, but deja vu all over again.....

Food security is national security. I applaud @realDonaldTrump & @SecretarySonny's work to support farmers, rural communities, & our ag sector during #COVID19. Unfortunately, Speaker Pelosi reduced funds available for rural America, but rest assured we're working to restore them. https://t.co/CxapfdefDS

Official IRS information about the COVID-19 pandemic and economic impact payments can be found on the Coronavirus Tax Relief page at the link below. The page is updated quickly when new information is available. (4/4) https://t.co/2bhUh7Tqo9

You don't have to sign up to receive an economic impact payment- it is automatic for any American who qualifies. In most cases, it'll be distributed how your 2019 tax return is distributed. If you haven't filed your 2019 return yet, info from your 2018 return will be used. (2/4)

I'm glad to announce that the #GA08 Congressional Art Competition will continue this year, however with modified submission requirements due to COVID-19. Students will submit their artwork via email, with the deadline extended to April 24. More info below: https://t.co/EGWv7uWX9O

Rural hospitals are a lifeline for millions. That’s why I joined over 120 of my colleagues in stressing the importance of supporting our rural hospitals & prioritizing funding & the resources they need to stay afloat, treat patients, & combat the spread of COVID-19. More below: https://t.co/TAoPx8ARXz

Over the last month, Congress has worked to provide resources for small businesses negatively impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. You can find a list of those resources and how to apply on my website by clicking here: https://t.co/5Z5sYF8hIO https://t.co/TwmNBLFjzO

Thank you to our #GA08 doctors, nurses, first responders, & all health care professionals working around the clock to combat the coronavirus & treat patients. America is the greatest country in the world & the best equipped to handle this crisis. We’ll get through this together. https://t.co/TFeOgrtlhV

A coronavirus stimulus package is now on its way to @realDonaldTrump's desk to be signed into law. While this certainly isn’t a perfect bill, this package will provide vital resources to health care facilities, businesses, & American families during this public health emergency.

My offices are continuing to monitor the #coronavirus illness and will be sure to provide updates as needed. You can find more information on the coronavirus on @CDCgov's website at https://t.co/Zz4tQAh7zP. (4/4) #GA08

Symptoms of #coronavirus may appear 2-14 days after exposure and can include fever, cough, and shortness of breath. If you have been to China or another impacted country within the last two weeks and develop symptoms, contact your health care provider immediately. (3/4) https://t.co/ZLqsgqoq0A

The @CDCgov recommends everyday preventive actions, including thoroughly washing your hands, avoiding close contact with people who are sick, and avoiding touching your eyes, nose and mouth. (2/4) https://t.co/nOo1CpQLrR

As coronavirus (also known as COVID-19) continues to spread outside of its area of origin in China, I wanted to share some information that may be helpful on how to detect and prevent the spread of this respiratory illness. (1/4)

I appreciate @gacities inviting me to speak at their Rural Broadband Summit this week. Broadband is much more than streaming video & sending emails, it’s crucial for everything from education to health care, & I’m fighting for more investment to bridge the digital divide. #GA08 https://t.co/YPbRpmJ2oT

Community health centers play a key role in bridging a gap in services for countless Georgians. I met with staff of First Choice Primary Care in Macon this week to discuss funding programs & ways we can increase access for those in our communities with limited access to care. https://t.co/uFi4HBBtmp

This morning, @sendavidperdue & I joined local leaders and South Central Primary Care Center in Ocilla to celebrate National Health Center Week. Our community health care centers are pivotal to the health & wellbeing of Georgians in rural communities throughout our state. #GA08 https://t.co/LR1m3r2Tnk

More than 24M Americans in rural communities don't have broadband access & lack the infrastructure for a reliable, affordable connection. From improving edu opportunities, to accessing health care, to innovative farming tech, broadband access is key in rural communities. (1/3)

While I'm glad to see this measure pass today, we must continue to ensure law enforcement at the border & immigration officials have the tools needed to secure the border, process immigration cases and asylum requests, & meet humanitarian needs.... (2/4)

They say they want to fix our broken healthcare system. If that’s the case, I call on my colleagues across the aisle to work with us to do so. You can watch my full remarks below: https://t.co/gechi2JTPh

One big change I've advocated for is to bring health insurers under the umbrella of US anti-trust laws. How can we expect lower premiums if these companies are exempt from anti-trust laws (which are in place for good reason & cover virtually every other industry in our country)?

Thank you, @POTUS, for your continued commitment to lower the cost of health care and prescription medications. I agree that the cost of health care in our country is unacceptable, and I look forward to working with you on this issue. #SOTU
Thank you to @RepGarretGraves for the fine Louisiana hospitality. My staff and I greatly appreciate it. #MardiGras ⚜️⚜️⚜️ https://t.co/3eJJJAWhQz

House Republicans are delivering on our promises to #ruralAmerica. The 2018 #FarmBill improves the #farmsafetynet, protects our natural resources, develops new trade agreements, prioritizes #ruralhealthcare, & expands quality #ruralbroadband. @HouseAgNews @HouseGOP

Thank you to members of the Lowndes County Board of Commissioners for meeting with me this past week. We had a good discussion on rural broadband, agriculture and health care, as well as issues pertinent to Moody Air Force Base. #GA08 https://t.co/7aAp0XujQp
Also, thank you to @valdostastate President Richard Carvajal for joining our health care policy trends discussion this morning. #VState #BlazerNation https://t.co/baVzv3Wmqs

Thank you to Prof. Russ Hoff and his “Current Issues and Trends in Health Care” class at @valdostastate for having me speak this morning on health care policy trends. I appreciate the opportunity to take part and the great questions from future health care professionals. #VState https://t.co/Set9BY5liU

Our @USNavy hospital ships (@USNSComfort & USNS Mercy) are instrumental in goodwill & humanitarian missions around the world, & I fought to ensure they were both maintained. I am very glad to see both will remain afloat to fulfill their important missions. https://t.co/6jVxauAdME

This would encompass an assessment of resources available to assist DOD by other U.S. interagency partners in their strategy to combat the #opioidepidemic, including @USPS and an analysis of potential opportunities for the Department to provide assistance in the future.

Glad to see my #FY19NDAA amendment requiring the @DeptofDefense to conduct an assessment of the assistance being provided to lead U.S. government agencies to combat the #OpioidEpidemic was approved by the Committee.

As our threats change, the US must maintain its soft power missions & that starts w/ our humanitarian response via hospital ships #USNSMercy & #USNSComfort. I'm a strong advocate of their missions & am pressing @USNavy to keep both ships in active service. https://t.co/WTGxG1Leul

Our two #USNavy hospital ships (#USNSMercy & #USNSComfort) complete critical missions of providing medical support to deployed troops & humanitarian assistance around the globe. I'm a strong advocate of their missions & am pressing for additional resources for their operations. https://t.co/VlehHF6qos

I appreciate having GA Veterans of Foreign Wars in my D.C. office this morning for a discussion on workforce development, health care, and veterans benefits. Thank you for taking the time to meet with me, and as always thank you for your service. #GA08 https://t.co/U4Wnct97Vv

Appreciate meeting with GA Assoc. of Health Underwriters in my D.C. office this week. Each person’s health care needs are different, & I'll continue to work towards policies that provide for flexibility & certainty for Georgians across the health care spectrum. https://t.co/ozE37kG8kn

Thanks, @kingdomgroupins, for having me visit with some of your brokers to discuss a few of the biggest issues impacting Georgians, like access to and cost of health care. #GA08 https://t.co/6MiqrpEcqc
